hanzi-su-wiki:
漕

Значения

Грести, крутить педали

Мнемоника

Упрощено. Решение суда 曹 каторга на морских 氵 галерах. Грести, крутить педали (как велорикша).
purpleculture_pinyin:
cáo
transport by water; watercourse; canal
водный транспорт; водоток; канал

purpleculture_examples: 漕运 [ cáo yùn ]: (old) to transport by water; to ship grain as tax

heisig_constituent: rowing, water, water droplets, water pistol, cadet, one, bend, sun, day
koohiiStory1: Bender the cadet (see frame 1172) is rowing, during some army exercise, and he´s very afraid of water (Bender is a robot).
koohiiStory2: The space cadet is in training, rowing in the water (see it splash).
jp_example_words: 漕ぐ(こぐ): to row, to scull, to pedal
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the cadet (曹) in the water (氵) is rowing
humanum_full_description_en:
From " water " to " Cao " sound. The original meaning is to transport food through waterways. Today's "Shuowen": "Cao, water turns the hub." Dang Yi Duan Yucai, Gui Fu, etc. changed to "water turns valley." Examples such as "Pipe. Light and Heavy E": "Qi immediately ordered Xi Peng Cao Su to Zhao." "Zhan Guo Ce. "Wei Ceyi": "Suliang Caoyu, no less than 100,000." Bao Biao's note: "Cao, water transport. Yu, water cano."

After " cao " refers to water transportation. Such as "Han Shu. "Zhao Chongguo Xinqing Ji Biography": "The ministers from the front of the army entered the mountain, and they felled more than 60,000 pieces of wood, all of them under the water... Sui Shu. Shihuo Zhi: "Therefore, Tongguan was launched in the east, and the Weishui was diverted from the west. Because of the use of manpower, the opening of the water canal and the calculation of merits are easy to achieve."

" Cao " also means a river channel for transportation. Such as "Selected Works. Ban Mengjian "Xidu Fu": "In the eastern suburbs, there are Tonggou Dacao, which collapses the Weidong River." And "Selected Works. Pan Anren "Xizheng Fu": "Cross the canal to divert the canal, the turbulent wind is generated, and there is a Kunming pond in it."

" Cao " was Weiyi in the Spring and Autumn Period, in the southeast of Huaxian County, Henan Province. Such as "Poetry. Bei Feng. "Drumming": "Tu Guocheng Cao, I travel south alone." Mao Chuan: "Cao, Wei Yi." And "Poetry. The wind. "Zai Chi": "Driving the horse leisurely, talking about the water."

" Cao " was also a kind of land tax during the Ming and Qing dynasties. After nagumi was collected, it was transported by water to the capital. It was also called "caofu" and "caoliang". For example, Wei Yuan of the Qing Dynasty "Cao Cao Pian 1": "The old water has changed in price, and the new water has been changed into silver. Is it possible?" Xu Ke, "Qing Barnyard Banknotes." Tuncao category. "Su Cao": "In the early Ming Dynasty, the Wu people were tortured. In addition to the dingy grain, don’t levy winter rice for every acre of farmland. Later it is called the water. The official book still calls it rice.
humanum_short_description_en: From " water " to " Cao " sound. The original meaning is to transport food through waterways.
humanum_full_description:
從「水」，「曹」聲。本義是以水道運送糧食。今本《說文》：「漕，水轉轂也。」當依段玉裁、桂馥等改為「水轉穀」。例子如《管子．輕重戊》：「齊即令隰朋漕粟於趙。」《戰國策．魏策一》：「粟糧漕庾，不下十萬。」鮑彪注：「漕，水運。庾，水漕倉。」

　　「漕」後泛指水路運輸。如《漢書．趙充國辛慶忌傳》：「臣前部士入山，伐材木大小六萬餘枚，皆在水次……冰解漕下。」顏師古注：「漕下，以水運木而下也。」《隋書．食貨志》：「故東發潼關，西引渭水，因藉人力，開通漕渠，量事計功，易可成就。」

　　「漕」也表示供運輸的河道。如《文選．班孟堅〈西都賦〉》：「東郊則有通溝大漕，潰渭洞河。」又《文選．潘安仁〈西征賦〉》：「交渠引漕，激湍生風，乃有昆明池乎其中。」

　　「漕」是春秋時衛邑，在今河南省滑縣東南。如《詩．邶風．擊鼓》：「土國城漕，我獨南行。」毛傳：「漕，衛邑。」又《詩．鄘風．載馳》：「驅馬悠悠，言至于漕。」

　　「漕」也是明、清時期一種田賦，徵納穀米後由水路運往京師，又稱「漕賦」、「漕糧」。如清代魏源〈籌漕篇上〉：「舊漕變價，新漕折銀，可乎？」徐珂《清稗類鈔．屯漕類．蘇漕》：「明初，虐待吳人，民田每畝，於丁糧之外，別徵冬米，後謂之漕，官書尚稱米，所謂正兌米、改兌米是也。」
humanum_short_description: 從「水」，「曹」聲。本義是以水道運送糧食。

漕字的基本解释

漕
cáo
利用水道转运粮食：漕运（旧时指国家从水道运输粮食，供应京城或接济军需）。漕粮。漕河。漕渠。漕船。

漕字的汉语字典释义

[①]［cáo］
［《廣韻》昨勞切，平豪，從。］
［《廣韻》在到切，去号，從。］
(1)水道运输。
(2)漕渠。
(3)谓开挖（漕渠）。
(4)漕米；漕粮。明清田赋的一种，征收谷米，后亦折银征收。
(5)宋元时漕运司及漕司的简称。
(6)水流急转处。
(7)春秋卫邑名。在今河南省滑县境。
(8)姓。汉有漕中叔。见《汉书·游侠传》。

漕字的英文翻译

◎ 漕
water transport

漕字的康熙字典解释

【巳集上】【水字部】　漕； 康熙笔画：15； 页码：页645第24
【唐韻】【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?在到切，曹去聲。【說文】水轉轂也。一曰人之所乗及船也。【前漢·武帝紀】穿漕渠通渭。【註】水轉曰漕。　又水運曰漕。【史記·蕭相國世家】轉漕給軍。　又姓。【史記·游俠傳】西河漕中叔。　又【廣韻】昨勞切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】財勞切，?音曹。衞邑名。【詩·邶風】土國城漕。　又【集韻】徂侯切，音鯫。亦水運也。

漕字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
漕字的起名意思

本义指通过水道运送粮食，也指可供运输的河道。

canal
Basic explanation of words
canal
cáo
Transshipment of grain by waterway: water transport (in the past refers to the state transporting grain through waterways, supplying capital or receiving military supplies). Caoliang. Caohe. Caoqu. Cao boat.
canal
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［cáo］
["Guangyun" worked hard yesterday, Pinghao, from. ]
["Guangyun" is in to cut, go to number, from. ]
(1) Waterway transportation.
(2) Caoqu.
(3) It is called excavation (cao ditch).
(4) Cao rice; Cao grain. A kind of Tian Fu in the Ming and Qing Dynasties, grain rice was expropriated, and later also converted into silver for expropriation.
(5) The abbreviation of the Water Transport Division and the Water Transport Division in the Song and Yuan Dynasties.
(6) The place where the current turns sharply.
(7) The name of Weiyi in Spring and Autumn Period. In today's Huaxian County, Henan Province.
(8) Last name. Han has Uncle Caozhong. See "Hanshu·The Legend of Ranger".
canal
English translation of words
◎ Cao
water transport
canal
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Si Ji 1] [Shui Zi Department] 　 Cao; Kangxi strokes: 15; Page number: page 645 24
[Tang Yun] [Ji Yun] [Rhyme Meeting] [Zheng Yun]? In to the cutting, Cao Qusheng. [Said the text] The water turns the hub too. The first is that people take and ship. [Pre-Han·Wu Emperor Ji] Passing through the Caoqu and Tongwei. [Note] The water turns into the water.　Shuiyun said Cao. 【Historical Records·Xiao Xiangguo Family】Transfer to the army.　Another last name. 【Historical Records · Ranger】Uncle Xihe Caozhong.　[Guang Yun] Yesterday, I worked hard [Ji Yun] [Yun Hui] [Zheng Yun] Wealthy hard,? Yin Cao. Weiyi name. 【Poetry·Bei Feng】Tu Guocheng Cao.　[Jiyun] Zuhouqie, sound 鲰. Also water transport.
canal
Source glyph

Japanese Ming Dynasty

Old glyph
canal
Name meaning
The original meaning refers to the transportation of food through waterways, and also refers to the rivers available for transportation.
cáo, zào
I гл.
перевозить податной хлеб водой
转漕 перевозить по суше и по воде продовольствие (напр. для войск); хлебные перевозки
漕忙 горячее время казённых перевозок продналога
II сущ.
1) стар. податное зерно, перевозимый налог зерном
2) протока, сосуд (напр. кровеносный)
血漕 кровеносный сосуд
III собств.
1) cáo ист., геогр. Цао (город царства Вэй на территории нынешней пров. Хэнань; эпоха Чунь-цю)
2) cáo, zào Цао, Цзао (фамилия)
